sect1.title: Introduction to KDE Frameworks
sect1.para: KDE Frameworks is a collection of libraries based on top of Qt5 and QML that can be used independently of KDE.

caution.para: The instructions for KDE Frameworks packages assume that was built with recommended dependencies installed and that Qt5 executables (such as qtpaths) are in user's $PATH before running the commands below.

sect2.title: Build Order
sect2.para: KDE Frameworks packages are listed in the recommended and tested build order based on dependencies.

sect2.title: Installing in /usr
sect2.para: One option is to install KDE Frameworks into the /usr hierarchy. This creates a simpler setup but makes it more difficult to try multiple versions of KDE Frameworks.
It is a good idea to add the following variables to your system or personal profile:

warning.para: If KDE4 is installed in /usr, some packages from this chapter might overwrite some programs installed by KDE4 packages.

sect2.title: Installing in /opt
sect2.para: A method of building multiple versions installs KDE Frameworks in the /opt hierarchy:
If you are not installing KDE Frameworks in /usr, you will need to make some additional configuration changes. Best practice is to add those to your system or personal profile:

screen.userinput:
cat > /etc/profile.d/kf5.sh << "EOF" # Begin /etc/profile.d/kf5.sh
export KF5_PREFIX=/opt/kf5 export QT5_PREFIX=$(qtpaths --plugin-dir | sed "s:/plugins::")
pathappend $KF5_PREFIX CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH pathappend $KF5_PREFIX/bin PATH pathappend $KF5_PREFIX/lib/pkgconfig PKG_CONFIG_PATH pathappend $KF5_PREFIX/lib/python&python2-majorver; PYTHONPATH pathappend $KF5_PREFIX/share XDG_DATA_DIRS
# End /etc/profile.d/kf5.sh EOF

cat >> /etc/ld.so.conf << "EOF" # Begin KF5 addition
/opt/kf5/lib
# End KF5 addition EOF

tip.para: Sometimes, the installation paths are hardcoded into installed files. This is the reason why /opt/kf5 is used as installation prefix instead of /opt/kf5-&kf5-version;. After installing KDE Frameworks, you may rename the directory and create a symlink:

Later on, you may want to install other versions of KDE Frameworks. To do that, just remove the symlink and use /opt/kf5 as the prefix again. Which version of KDE Frameworks you use depends only on where the symlink points to. No other reconfiguration will be needed.
